intro: Hieracium portlandicum, commonly known as the Portland groundsel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the British Isles and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed ground. It has a rosette of basal leaves and produces a single flowering stem with numerous small yellow flowers. Hieracium portlandicum is considered a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution across the UK.
